definition: lit. Rushing Clan, generation born between 1975-1985 and China's most hedonistic and hard-working social group (netspeak)
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: There are many rushing clans in the cities.
The rushing clans are full of vigors.

definition: car slave, sb forced to sacrifice quality of life to buy or maintain a car
the working poor
"ant tribe", college graduates who endure cramped living conditions while trying to develop a career
"a slave to certificates", sb who does one's utmost to obtain as many certificates as possible so to be more employable
new generation of youths (generation X, Y etc)
fig. unmarried person/single person (especially one who is comfortable financially)
"a slave to one's children", hard-working parents who would do everything to ensure their children's well-being, in disregard of their own needs
lit. moonlight group/fig. those who spend their monthly income even before they earn their next salary (slang)
those who did not benefit from the Chinese economic reforms of the 1980s/see also 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
a slave to one's mortgage
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
pampered young people unaccustomed to hardship (Tw)
(coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents
(Internet slang) spoiled city girl from a rich family
white-collar/white-collar worker
salaried class
